Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_248932: How to rename group files
so_22315490: How to rename this files
au_687732: Rename multiple files remove all characters
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_248932: i=0
for file in tl*.jpg
do
    printf -v counter "%05d" $i
    mv $file photo$counter.jpg
    i=$((i+1))
done

so_22315490: for file in [0-9]*.txt; do     
  mv "$file" $(printf %04d.%s ${file%.*} ${file##*.})
done

$ touch 1.txt 2.txt 3.txt
$ ls
1.txt  2.txt  3.txt
$ for file in [0-9]*.txt; do     
mv "$file" $(printf %04d.%s ${file%.*} ${file##*.})
done
$ ls
0001.txt  0002.txt  0003.txt

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_687732: Rename multiple files remove all characters
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_191514: cnt=0
for i in *; do
  let cnt=cnt+1
  mv "$i" "$(echo "${i}_${cnt}" | awk -F_ '{print $1"_"$3}')"
done

cnt=0
for i in 71116*; do
  let cnt=cnt+1
  mv "$i" "$(echo "${i}_${cnt}" | awk -F_ '{print $1"_"$3}')"
done

ul_626576: LC_COLLATE=C n=0 sh -c '
for i in ./*.mp4; do echo mv "$i" "test$((n+=1)).mp4"; done'

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_449965: Copy files under modified name
su_1136926: How to rename multiple file name include subfolders?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_529542: find $katalog -name '*.dav.avi' -execdir rename .dav.avi .avi {} \;

find . -name "*.dav.avi" | while read file; do newFile=`echo $file | awk '{ print substr($0,1,match($0,"\\[")-1) ".avi"; }'`; mv $file $newFile; done

su_1136926: find . -type f -name '*.png' -execdir bash -c 'mv "$1" "${1%.png}@2x.png"' Move {} \;

$ find . -type f -name '*.png' -execdir bash -c 'mv "$1" "${1%.png}@2x.png"' Move {} \;
